intro: Cinnamomum calciphilum, commonly known as the limestone cinnamon, is a rare and specialized plant adapted to grow in calcareous soils. It belongs to the Lauraceae family, which includes other aromatic plants such as cinnamon and laurel. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers. It produces small, dark purple berries that contain the seeds. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is often found in rocky or limestone-rich environments.
